questions.question: When I have guests I myself cook dinner for ……………………
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: When she realized her mistake she laughed at ……………………
questions.description: The reflexive is used when the subject and the object refer to the same person.

questions.question: Susie prevented me from entering …………………….. room.
questions.description: The words her, his, their, your, our and my are possessive adjectives. They are used before nouns.

questions.question: She yelled at ………………………… without any provocation.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: That is ………………………….
questions.description: Possessive pronouns are words like mine, his, hers, theirs, ours, yours etc. They are used alone as subject complements.

questions.question: This is my car. Is that ………………………….?
I did it …………………………. as there was no one to help me.
questions.description: The emphatic is used to emphasize an idea.

questions.question: I cut ………………………… while shaving.
questions.description: The reflexive is used when the subject and the object refer to the same person.

questions.question: She admired ……………………………. in the mirror.
questions.description: The reflexive is used when the subject and the object refer to the same person.
